page.title: 19Customs in Knypersley.
page.content: The local customs of the Knypersley area are largely those of North Saffordshire. Oatcakes,a type of pancake,are trad- itional of our area. We are the only place in England which makes them. A one mile race held in this area every year attracts people from as far as Plymouth. The race ends at Mow Cop Castle and the prize for running the race under 6 mins. and 30 sec. is 600 pounds.The race is up a steep hill! Egging and flouring is a local custom among the school children.On a pupil's birthday their friends throw eggs and flour over them. The Potters industrial two week holiday is unique to the Potteries area.This takes place in the last week of June and the first week of July.
